I approve of this.  How it will be handled:
- if the analysis code is naive, then different VARIATIONS will look like different SURVEYS.  This is fine.
-  if the analysis code is smart, it will KNOW to split on `::`.  
- analysts will be SMART and not use `::` as part of a surveyId.
- [x] confirm that uu / query args handle colon fine.  -- turns out this is irrelevant, anyway

I approve of this. How it will be handled:

  • if the analysis code is naive, then different VARIATIONS will look like different SURVEYS. This is fine.
  • if the analysis code is smart, it will KNOW to split on ::.
